intro: Blysmocarex nudicarpa, commonly known as the naked-fruited sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to the wetlands of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other monocot plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Blysmocarex nudicarpa thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs and marshes.
